intro: Pycnandra carinocostata, commonly known as the narrow-ribbed pycnandra, is a flowering plant native to Madagascar. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its small, elliptical leaves with prominent midribs. The plant produces small, clustered white flowers that are typically borne on short pedicels. Its fruit is a capsule that dehisces to release small, wind-dispersed seeds. Pycnandra carinocostata is often found in humid, shaded environments within the rainforest understory.
